snippet: Creative marine reserves in the south polar region would seem like a no-brainer. So why are plans being scaled back?
abstract: Editorial laments that United States and other nations have capitulated in effort to establish extensive marine reserves in Southern Ocean around Antarctica; argues decision, which shrinks proposal by 40 percent, rewards recklessness of opposing nations and turns blind eye to fragility of one of world's last pristine ecosystems.
lead_paragraph: Creative marine reserves in the south polar region would seem like a no-brainer. So why are plans being scaled back?

keywords.value: Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources
keywords.name: organizations
